title: Etsy’s Scaled-Back Share Price Is a ‘Strong Buying Opportunity,’ Analyst Says
text:
Text size

Shares of Etsy , the digital craft marketplace, rose as an analyst upgraded the stock, saying its slide from summer prices indicates a “strong buying opportunity.”

The stock (ticker: ETSY) was up $1.96, or 3.6%, to $56.84 in early afternoon on Friday. As of the close of trading on Thursday, the shares had risen about 15% in 2019, slightly behind the gain in the S&P 500.

The stock has fallen from above $70, largely because management issued a less upbeat outlook for Etsy’s full-year performance in early August. The company is making “bold bets that set us up for an even brighter future,” CEO Josh Silverman said at the time.

On Friday, Wedbush’s Ygal Arounian said investors shouldn’t worry. He upgraded the stock from Neutral to Outperform and raised his price target by $2 to $66, 20% above Thursday’s closing price of $54.88. Among his reasons: the company’s aforementioned “bets,” including the development of an ad platform and a push to get more sellers to offer free shipping.

Those bets, Arounian wrote, represent a “critical mass” that he thinks could boost growth in sales on Etsy’s platform, as well as the company’s margins. “We particularly like the timing with both Etsy Ads and free shipping launching into the holiday season supported by Etsy’s brand marketing push,” he wrote. Wedbush sees “the about 25% pullback in shares since July highs as a strong buying opportunity.”

Those sentiments echo others Barron’s wrote about last month. Another analyst suggested that “short-term-oriented momentum investors may have exited positions.”

Etsy has also acquired a music marketplace it plans to operate separately, perhaps suggesting a willingness to use mergers and acquisitions to expand the markets it can tap.

Given “management’s strong track record of improvements to date, we see a lot more to come,” Arounian wrote.

description: Management issued a less upbeat outlook for the digital craft marketplace’s full-year performance in early August, sending the stock down.
